2:
Start playing the music, and beat the tambourines;
\q2 play nice music on the harps and lyres.
\b
\q1
3:
Blow the trumpets during the festival to celebrate each new moon,
\q2 each time the moon is full, and during our other festivals.
\q1
5:
He gave it to the Israelite people when he punished the people of Egypt land.
\b
\q1 That was where I heard them speaking in a language that I did not know.
\q1
6:
God says this: "After the rulers of Egypt forced you Israelites to work as slaves,
\q1 I took those heavy burdens off your backs,
\q2 and I enabled you to lay down those heavy baskets of bricks that you were carrying.
\q1
7:
When you were greatly distressed, you called out to me, and I rescued you;
\q2 I answered you out of a thundercloud.
\q2 Later I tested whether you would trust me to give you water when you were in the desert at Meribah.
\q1
8:
You who are my people, listen while I warn you!
\q1 I wish that you Israelite people would pay attention to what I say to you!
\q1
12:
So because they were very stubborn,
\q2 I allowed them to do whatever they wanted to do.
\b
\q1
13:
I wish that my people would listen to me,
\q1 that the Israelite people would behave as I want them to do.
\q1
15:
Then all those who hate me would cringe before me,
\q2 and then I would punish them forever.
\q1
16:
But I would give you Israelites very good wheat,
\q2 and I would fill your stomachs with wild honey."
81:
\d A psalm written by Asaph for the choir director
\b
\q1
